androidx.wear.widget

Class ConfirmationOverlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • androidx.wear.widget.ConfirmationOverlay

  • public class ConfirmationOverlay
extends java.lang.Object
    Displays a full-screen confirmation animation with optional text and then hides it.

    This is a lighter-weight version of ConfirmationActivity and should be preferred when constructed from an Activity.

    Sample usage: 

       // Defaults to SUCCESS_ANIMATION
   new ConfirmationOverlay().showOn(myActivity);

   new ConfirmationOverlay()
      .setType(ConfirmationOverlay.OPEN_ON_PHONE_ANIMATION)
      .setDuration(3000)
      .setMessage("Opening...")
      .setFinishedAnimationListener(new ConfirmationOverlay.OnAnimationFinishedListener() {
           @Override
          public void onAnimationFinished() {
              // Finished animating and the content view has been removed from myActivity.
          }
      }).showOn(myActivity);

   // Default duration is DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION_MS
   new ConfirmationOverlay()
      .setType(ConfirmationOverlay.FAILURE_ANIMATION)
      .setMessage("Failed")
      .setFinishedAnimationListener(new ConfirmationOverlay.OnAnimationFinishedListener() {
           @Override
          public void onAnimationFinished() {
              // Finished animating and the view has been removed from myView.getRootView().
          }
      }).showAbove(myView);

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  ConfirmationOverlay.OnAnimationFinishedListener
      Interface for listeners to be notified when the ConfirmationOverlay animation has finished and its View has been removed.
      static interface  ConfirmationOverlay.OverlayType
      Types of animations to display in the overlay.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION_MS
      Default animation duration in ms.
      static int FAILURE_ANIMATION
      ConfirmationOverlay.OverlayType indicating the failure overlay should be shown.
      static int OPEN_ON_PHONE_ANIMATION
      ConfirmationOverlay.OverlayType indicating the "Open on Phone" animation overlay should be displayed.
      static int SUCCESS_ANIMATION
      ConfirmationOverlay.OverlayType indicating the success animation overlay should be displayed.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void hide()
      Starts a fadeout animation and removes the view once finished.
      ConfirmationOverlay setDuration(int millis)
      Sets the duration in milliseconds which controls how long the animation will be displayed.
      ConfirmationOverlay setFinishedAnimationListener(ConfirmationOverlay.OnAnimationFinishedListener listener)
      Sets the ConfirmationOverlay.OnAnimationFinishedListener which will be invoked once the overlay is no longer visible.
      ConfirmationOverlay setMessage(java.lang.String message)
      Sets a message which will be displayed at the same time as the animation.
      ConfirmationOverlay setType(int type)
      Sets the ConfirmationOverlay.OverlayType which controls which animation is displayed.
      void showAbove(View view)
      Adds the overlay as a child of view.getRootView(), removing it when complete.
      void showOn(Activity activity)
      Adds the overlay as a content view to the activity, removing it when complete.

      • FAILURE_ANIMATION

        public static final int FAILURE_ANIMATION
        ConfirmationOverlay.OverlayType indicating the failure overlay should be shown. The icon associated with this type, unlike the others, does not animate.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • setMessage

        public ConfirmationOverlay setMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Sets a message which will be displayed at the same time as the animation.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • setType

        public ConfirmationOverlay setType(int type)
        Sets the ConfirmationOverlay.OverlayType which controls which animation is displayed.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • setDuration

        public ConfirmationOverlay setDuration(int millis)
        Sets the duration in milliseconds which controls how long the animation will be displayed. Default duration is DEFAULT_ANIMATION_DURATION_MS.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • setFinishedAnimationListener

        public ConfirmationOverlay setFinishedAnimationListener(@Nullable
                                                        ConfirmationOverlay.OnAnimationFinishedListener listener)
        Sets the ConfirmationOverlay.OnAnimationFinishedListener which will be invoked once the overlay is no longer visible.
        Returns:
        this object for method chaining.

      • showAbove

        @MainThread
public void showAbove(View view)
        Adds the overlay as a child of view.getRootView(), removing it when complete. While it is shown, all touches will be intercepted to prevent accidental taps on obscured views.

      • showOn

        @MainThread
public void showOn(Activity activity)
        Adds the overlay as a content view to the activity, removing it when complete. While it is shown, all touches will be intercepted to prevent accidental taps on obscured views.

      • hide

        @MainThread
public void hide()
        Starts a fadeout animation and removes the view once finished. This is invoked by mHideRunnable after mDurationMillis milliseconds.

Generated javadoc for the new package structure to make it clearer which packages are bundled with the Android operating system, and which are packaged with your app's APK. Going forward, the android.* package hierarchy will be reserved for Android packages that ship with the operating system; other packages will be issued in the new androidx.* package hiearchy.
